result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ALLEN C EDWARDS

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant ALLEN C EDWARDS appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for ALLEN C EDWARDS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states the defendant does not have the capacity to understand proceedings but is likely to attain competency.  Off the record at 2:00 PM. 

Back on the record at 2:25 PM.  Appearances remain the same. Atty Zamzow has talked with the defendant regarding the doctor's report and defendant is not contesting. State is not contesting the doctor's report. Court questions defendant if he is competent. Statement by defendant - is not competent. Court finds the defendant not competent.

Court adjourned at 2:27 PM

Court sets for Status Hearing on February 7, 2023 at 1:00 PM.
Letter to the defendant dated 09/22/2022 re: Court appoints Atty Jeanne Zamzow. Defendant is to pay $50.00 per month commencing October 31, 2022 for court appointed attorney fees.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant came to Clerk of Courts office after his hearing today and his wife requested permission for defendant to appear via telephone for his next hearing on October 25, 2022, as he does not drive and lives in Oshkosh. He was given Zoom instructions.

10:46 AM Defendant ALLEN C EDWARDS in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he does not qualify for public defender. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Statement by defendant. Court orders a competency examination. Court waives all time limits. Court sets for Status Hearing on October 25, 2022 at 1:45 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:50 AM
Status hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:55 AM Defendant ALLEN C EDWARDS in court.  Atty Michael Kapelis appears with the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim ion September 6, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:58 AM
